title: Emergency Password
text: There is a function to create an Emergency password for Omnis\Sigma for any user set up in the system. This can be used if you need to connect on and log into Omnis\Sigma and you do not know the customers SUPER password. You might require it if a Omnis\Sigma user has forgotten their password. It is located on K3DEV-WAL0002 Enter todays date to generate todays Emergency Password:-
description:
There is a function to create an Emergency password for Omnis\Sigma for any user set up in the system.


This can be used if you need to connect on and log into Omnis\Sigma and you do not know the customers SUPER password. You might require it if a Omnis\Sigma user has forgotten their password.


It is located on K3DEV-WAL0002



Enter todays date to generate todays Emergency Password:-

title: Generating a Sigma key
text: To generate a Sigma key you need to open the Key Generator program which is located on the Tenant VPC K3DEV-WAL0002 To check the version being used by the customer and the current key you need to open Freshdesk>Contracts and bring up the details for the Sigma Customer:- https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/custom-objects/schemas/59737/records Click Edit and copy the Licence key and paste it into the relevant Sigma key option:- In this example the customer is running 9.922 and there you need to select Sigma Post VAT (MTD) and paste in the key and select Verify:- Amend the Expiry date to the required date and click Generate:- Sent the key to the customer and update the Contract with the new key and expiry date.
description:
To generate a Sigma key you need to open the Key Generator program which is located on the Tenant VPC K3DEV-WAL0002



To check the version being used by the customer and the current key you need to open Freshdesk>Contracts and bring up the details for the Sigma Customer:-


https://k3support.freshdesk.com/a/custom-objects/schemas/59737/records


Click Edit and copy the Licence key and paste it into the relevant Sigma key option:-



In this example the customer is running 9.922 and there you need to select Sigma Post VAT (MTD) and paste in the key and select Verify:-


Amend the Expiry date to the required date and click Generate:-



Sent the key to the customer and update the Contract with the new key and expiry date.

title: Sigma Key Generation Version
text: The CD Key Generator has four different options for Sigma:- Sigma Post 8.311 Sigma Post 8.707 Sigma Post VAT (MTD) Sigma Pre 8.311 Three are obvious but the Sigma Post VAT (MTD) is for Post V.902
description:
The CD Key Generator has four different options for Sigma:-


Sigma Post 8.311

Sigma Post 8.707

Sigma Post VAT (MTD)

Sigma Pre 8.311


Three are obvious but the Sigma Post VAT (MTD) is for Post V.902

title: All Sigma ledgers - Session numbers are incompatible
text: All ledgers - Session numbers are incompatible Issue Incompatible session numbers error The first time each day that a user logs into any Sigma ledger the program updates all the files with a session number. If the session numbers on the files are not all the same the system will detect that the session numbers are incompatible and processing will not be allowed to continue until the issue is resolved. Possible causes:- 1. If a few files of the file list displayed on the screen have a session number that is only one less than the other files displayed then it is probable that an illegal exit (re-boot or power off) was made from the ledger during the sign-on process or files were left locked from the previous session. 2. If any session numbers are zero then it is likely that some of the data files for the ledger have been deleted accidentally or in error 3. If any session numbers are 8224 the file is corrupted. 4. The restoration of data files from a security copy has failed for some reason and has not restored all of the data files. 5. The restoration of data files has taken place from an incomplete security copy. Resolution 1. If a few of the files session numbers are only one less than the other files and a restore has not been attempted you can issue a reset code. You will need to obtain the System Date of the ledger that has this error. This is the date in the bottom right of the screen, next to the ledger name:- Open the Sigma Session Reset program on K3DEV-WAL0002 and enter the date into the in the format of DDMMYY Issue the code and advise the user to click the Reset button in the Incompatible session numbers error screen. If any of the session number of files are zero, 8224 or more than 1 session out, restore the data files. Ensure that all of the data files required for the ledger (as noted in step 1) are included on the security copy that you wish to restore. If they are, restore the data files from the security copy and ensure that all files are restored correctly. If some files are missing from the security copy then it will be necessary to go back to an earlier security copy. If the session numbers are still reported as incompatible then restore to an earlier backup until a good security copy is found. You should note that each step backward will almost certainly require re-input of data entered since the security copy was taken
description:
All ledgers - Session numbers are incompatible


Issue


 Incompatible session numbers error

 

The first time each day that a user logs into any Sigma ledger the program updates all the files with a session number. If the session numbers on the files are not all the same the system will detect that the session numbers are incompatible and processing will not be allowed to continue until the issue is resolved.

 

Possible causes:-

 

1. If a few files of the file list displayed on the screen have a session number that is only one less than the other files displayed then it is probable that an illegal exit (re-boot or power off) was made from the ledger during the sign-on process or files were left locked from the previous session.

 

2. If any session numbers are zero then it is likely that some of the data files for the ledger have been deleted accidentally or in error

 

3. If any session numbers are 8224 the file is corrupted.

 

4. The restoration of data files from a security copy has failed for some reason and has not restored all of the data files. 

 

5. The restoration of data files has taken place from an incomplete security copy.


Resolution


1. If a few of the files session numbers are only one less than the other files and a restore has not been attempted you can issue a reset code. You will need to obtain the System Date of the ledger that has this error. This is the date in the bottom right of the screen, next to the ledger name:-

Open the Sigma Session Reset program on K3DEV-WAL0002 and enter the date into the  in the format of DDMMYY



Issue the code and advise the user to click the Reset button in the Incompatible session numbers error screen.

 

If any of the session number of files are zero, 8224 or more than 1 session out, restore the data files. Ensure that all of the data files required for the ledger (as noted in step 1) are included on the security copy that you wish to restore. If they are, restore the data files from the security copy and ensure that all files are restored correctly. If some files are missing from the security copy then it will be necessary to go back to an earlier security copy. 

 

If the session numbers are still reported as incompatible then restore to an earlier backup until a good security copy is found. You should note that each step backward will almost certainly require re-input of data entered since the security copy was taken
